page.title: 02FARMING, THEBURTON
page.content: The farms are arable with few cattle. A farmer asked what made his choice of crops, the answer was profit and thus the crops are wheat and barley and not many cattle, so minimising a milk surplus. Some beet is grown and rape, less beans and peas even though these carry a government subsidy, but one farmer said they are not easy crops, labour intensive and more subject to weather damage than cereals. To rid the fields of stubble after harvesting, it is often burnt, in which case fires are strictly controlled and the remains must be ploughed in within 24 hours to lessen pollution. A little oats and potatoes are grown. 140 bullocks are reared, and another farm has a small dairy herd. Several farms have a few goats, chickens, ducks and pigs. There is some muck spreading & chemical usage.
